DataElement.preferredName: Institutional Review Board Approval Consent Form Research Activity Data Submission Signature Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the recipient signed an IRB-approved consent form for submitting research data.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Institutional Review Board Approval Consent Form Research Activity Data Submission Signature
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A document containing the determination of the Institutional Review Board (IRB) that the clinical study with human subject participation has been reviewed and may be conducted at a particular study site within the constraints set forth by the IRB and other institutional and federal requirements. The regulations require that an IRB conduct continuing review of research at intervals appropriate to the degree of risk, but not less than once a year._A document explaining all relevant study information to assist the study volunteer in understanding the expectations and requirements of participation in a clinical trial. This document is presented to and signed by the study subject. (from centerwatch.com glossary)_Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn._The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something._ Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Institutional Review Board Approval Consent Form
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A document containing the determination of the Institutional Review Board (IRB) that the clinical study with human subject participation has been reviewed and may be conducted at a particular study site within the constraints set forth by the IRB and other institutional and federal requirements. The regulations require that an IRB conduct continuing review of research at intervals appropriate to the degree of risk, but not less than once a year.:A document explaining all relevant study information to assist the study volunteer in understanding the expectations and requirements of participation in a clinical trial. This document is presented to and signed by the study subject. (from centerwatch.com glossary)

Concepts.definition: A document containing the determination of the Institutional Review Board (IRB) that the clinical study with human subject participation has been reviewed and may be conducted at a particular study site within the constraints set forth by the IRB and other institutional and federal requirements. The regulations require that an IRB conduct continuing review of research at intervals appropriate to the degree of risk, but not less than once a year.

A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian.

Property.preferredDefinition: Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.:Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; an identifying feature or characteristic of something or someone; an alternative term for motif or pattern; the part of the prescription that contains directions to the patient for taking of medicine.

Concepts.definition: Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.
Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Not Approached Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, Not Applicable or Not Approached to a question.[manually curated]

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This information has not been sought (e.g., patient was not asked)

Concepts.definition: No inquiry was made to gather this information.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Not Asked Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:This information has not been sought (e.g., patient was not asked):An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
No inquiry was made to gather this information.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
